instructions: Cook the spaghetti according to package instructions.
In a separate pan, cook the pancetta until crispy.
Add minced garlic to the pan and cook for another minute.
In a bowl, whisk together the eggs and grated Parmesan cheese.
Drain the cooked spaghetti and immediately add it to the pan with pancetta and garlic.
Pour the egg mixture over the hot spaghetti and toss well to coat the pasta.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot and garnish with additional Parmesan cheese if desired.
In a bowl, combine yogurt, lemon juice, cumin, paprika, turmeric, garam masala, and chili powder.
Add chicken cubes to the marinade, mix well, and let it marinate for at least 1 hour.
In a large pan, melt butter over medium heat.
Add chopped onions and minced garlic to the pan and cook until onions are soft and translucent.
Add marinated chicken to the pan and cook until browned on all sides.
Stir in tomato puree and simmer for 10 minutes.
Add heavy cream and salt to taste, and cook for an additional 10 minutes.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve hot with rice or naan bread.
Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
In a large mixing bowl, cream together the softened butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until well combined.
Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the vanilla extract.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, and salt.

description: Alexandra Lee is a talented chef with a passion for creating delicious and healthy dishes. With 6 years of experience in the culinary industry, she specializes in Mediterranean cuisine, sushi, and crafting nutritious recipes. Her creations are known for their vibrant flavors and beautiful presentation.
